title: Writing "/etc/hosts" breaks the Substack editor
summary:
The article "Writing '/etc/hosts' breaks the Substack editor" details how directly modifying the `/etc/hosts` file can unexpectedly disrupt the functionality of Substack's editor. The author recounts a personal experience where they altered their `/etc/hosts` file to redirect a specific domain for testing purposes, inadvertently causing the Substack editor to break.

The key takeaway is that Substack relies on certain domains and services, and interfering with their resolution through `/etc/hosts` can lead to unexpected issues within the editor, such as an inability to save drafts, problems with image uploads, and general editor unresponsiveness. The article emphasizes that this occurs because Substack's editor makes API calls to its own infrastructure. When the domain resolution is tampered with, these calls fail.

The author’s solution involved reverting the changes made to the `/etc/hosts` file, effectively restoring the correct domain resolution for Substack's services. The piece serves as a cautionary tale for developers and power users who routinely modify their `/etc/hosts` file, highlighting the importance of considering the potential impact on web applications that depend on specific domain resolutions. It underscores the hidden dependencies that modern web applications have and how seemingly innocuous system-level modifications can have significant consequences.

title: Eurorack Knob Idea
summary:
Mitxela details his "Eurorack Knob Idea," a novel approach to Eurorack module design aimed at reducing panel clutter. The concept replaces traditional potentiometers with a hybrid knob and patch cable system. This system uses a 3.5mm TRS jack in place of a potentiometer, coupled with a magnetic encoder chip (AS5600) positioned beneath the jack. A small neodymium magnet is embedded in the TRS plug, functioning as the knob. When plugged in, the magnet interacts with the AS5600, translating the knob's rotation into an angle reading that can be used to control module parameters.

The author describes the construction of the magnetic knob, circuit board design incorporating the AS5600 and a microcontroller (CH32V003) for reading and displaying the encoder data, and assembly process. The prototype successfully detects the presence of the magnetic knob via field strength readings, differentiating it from standard patch cables.

Despite the successful prototype, the author acknowledges the potential impracticality and high cost of implementing this idea across an entire Eurorack system. He envisions a niche community, "Euroknobists," dedicated to this concept. While not pursuing a patent, he suggests a more commercially viable alternative: a potentiometer with a coaxial TRS jack. He concludes by inviting entrepreneurs to fund and develop the idea, acknowledging his own limitations in that area.

title: Show HN: Magnitude – open-source, AI-native test framework for web apps
summary:
Magnitude is a new open-source, AI-native testing framework for web applications. It allows users to build and run end-to-end tests using natural language, leveraging visual AI agents to understand and adapt to UI changes.

Here's how it works: users write test cases with simple steps, data inputs, and checks in natural language. Magnitude uses a strong, general multi-modal LLM (like Gemini) as a "planner" to strategize the test and a fast vision LLM (Moondream) as an "executor" to interact with the UI with pixel-level precision. If issues arise during execution, the reasoning agent intervenes.

To get started, users install the `magnitude-test` package, initialize Magnitude in their project, and configure API keys for both the planner and executor LLMs. Tests are then run via the `npx magnitude` command. Magnitude supports parallel test execution.

The framework focuses on making test case creation easy by enabling users to describe tests as they would to a coworker. Tests can be integrated into CI/CD pipelines.

Magnitude differentiates itself from solutions like OpenAI Operator/Claude Computer Use by using specialized models for planning and execution. This approach aims to improve speed, reliability, and cost-effectiveness specifically for testing scenarios.

title: Huge reproducibility project fails to validate biomedical studies
summary:
A large-scale reproducibility project, the Brazilian Reproducibility Initiative, assessed the replicability of biomedical studies from Brazil, focusing on research employing three common methods: a cell metabolism assay, a genetic material amplification technique, and a rodent maze test. Over 200 scientists across 56 labs attempted to replicate experiments from 47 papers published between 1998 and 2017.

The results were dismaying, with less than half of the tested experiments being reproducible. Using five criteria, only 21% of experiments were replicable across at least half of the criteria. The effect sizes in the original papers were also, on average, 60% larger than in the replication attempts, suggesting a tendency for original studies to overestimate the effects of interventions.

The study highlights the need to strengthen scientific practices in Brazil and provides a basis for implementing changes in public policies and within universities. The ambitious project faced logistical challenges during the COVID-19 pandemic and discrepancies in adherence to protocols among the participating teams.

结果令人沮丧，只有不到一半的测试实验可重复。使用五个标准，只有 21% 的实验在至少一半的标准上是可重复的。原始论文中的效应量平均也比重复尝试中的大 60%，表明原始研究倾向于高估干预措施的效果。

该研究强调了加强巴西科学实践的必要性，并为在公共政策和大学内部实施变革提供了基础。这项雄心勃勃的项目在 COVID-19 大流行期间面临物流挑战，并且参与团队在遵守协议方面存在差异。

title: Exploiting Undefined Behavior in C/C++ Programs: The Performance Impact [pdf]
summary:
This paper, "Exploiting Undefined Behavior in C/C++ Programs: The Performance Impact," explores the performance implications of relying on undefined behavior (UB) in C/C++ code. The core argument is that compilers, when encountering UB, are free to make optimizations that can drastically alter program behavior, often leading to unexpected performance gains or, more frequently, subtle bugs and performance degradation.

The article likely uses a combination of theoretical analysis and practical experiments to demonstrate how specific instances of UB, such as signed integer overflow, out-of-bounds array access, or dereferencing null pointers, can trigger compiler optimizations. These optimizations might include dead code elimination, loop unrolling, or speculative execution, which can either improve performance in specific scenarios or introduce unpredictable behavior.

The paper emphasizes the challenges in reasoning about the performance of code that relies on UB, as the observed behavior is highly compiler-dependent and can change across different versions, optimization levels, or even seemingly unrelated code modifications. Furthermore, the article likely suggests best practices for avoiding UB, advocating for writing code that adheres to the C/C++ standards and using tools like static analyzers and sanitizers to detect and eliminate potential instances of UB. The ultimate goal is to promote robust and predictable performance by writing well-defined code that compilers can optimize safely and effectively.

title: UIT – performant, modular, low-memory file processing at scale, in the Cloud
summary:
UIT (Universal Information Terminal) is a library designed for performant, modular, and low-memory file processing at scale in the cloud. It offers a 4-step process: ingest, filter/transform, merge, and output, enabling users to gather file hierarchies from various sources, apply transformations, and output them in desired formats.

UIT emphasizes performance through streaming and parallelization, allowing it to operate efficiently in low-memory environments like Cloudflare workers. Its modular design ensures composability and a clear overview of building blocks, with each module potentially running in different locations.

The library leverages FormData for handling multiple files and binary data, using the Streams API for intermediate results. It provides several modules: `uithub.ingestzip` (ZIP ingestion), `uithub.merge` (FormData merging), `uithub.outputmd` (Markdown output), `uithub.outputzip` (ZIP packaging), `uithub.search` (search capabilities), `uithub.ziptree` (ZIP hierarchy extraction), `uithub.otp` (secret management), and `uithub` (UI Module).

The UIT Protocol defines the conventions for UIT modules, categorizing them into ingest, merge, filter/transform, and output modules. It specifies the required and custom FormData headers used for processing files, including `Content-Disposition`, `Content-Type`, `x-url`, and `x-file-hash`.

UIT encourages contributions and aims to create a plugin system for easier file filtering and transformation. The project is open-sourced, welcoming developers to add modules. It's currently in pre-release and looking for sponsors.

title: "Poetry City": Iowa City, Iowa
summary:
Harry Stecopoulos's "Poetry City: Iowa City, Iowa" explores the tension between Iowa City's well-known image as a UNESCO City of Literature and its lesser-known history as a countercultural hub. The article highlights the city's literary prominence, exemplified by the Iowa Writers' Workshop, authors' plaques in the sidewalks, numerous literary readings, and the presence of thousands of writers.

However, Stecopoulos argues that beneath this mainstream literary identity lies a vibrant counterculture. He details the city's history of anti-war activism and artistic experimentation, referencing figures like Denis Johnson, Vito Acconci, and Ana Mendieta. Landmark sites like Dave's Fox Head Tavern and George's Buffet serve as reminders of this past.

The article emphasizes the persistence of this countercultural spirit, even as urban renewal and real estate development have erased some of its physical traces. New institutions like Public Space One and the Center for Afrofuturist Studies, founded by Anaïs Duplan, demonstrate a continuing commitment to alternative artistic expression. Publications like Vetch: A Magazine of Trans Poetry and Poetics and events like Feed Me Weird Things further illustrate this point.

Stecopoulos concludes by arguing that preserving the "weirdness" of college towns like Iowa City is crucial for fostering intellectual and artistic innovation, resisting the status quo, and creating groundbreaking works. These environments provide unique opportunities for challenging norms and pushing boundaries.

title: Exercise before bed is linked with disrupted sleep
summary:
A new study led by Monash University found a link between exercising close to bedtime and disrupted sleep. Published in Nature Communications, the study monitored 14,689 individuals over a year, using biometric devices to track exercise, sleep, and cardiovascular data.

The research revealed that exercising within four hours of bedtime, especially high-strain activities, was associated with delayed sleep onset, shorter sleep duration, lower sleep quality, higher resting heart rate, and lower heart rate variability. These results were adjusted for factors like age, gender, and prior sleep. High-strain exercises include activities like HIIT workouts or long runs that significantly elevate heart rate and breathing.

Researchers suggest that people aiming to improve sleep health should conclude exercise at least four hours before bedtime. If exercising within that window, they recommend low-intensity activities like light jogging or swimming. The study highlights that evening exercise, particularly high-strain activities, can disrupt sleep and impair the body's recovery process. These findings have significant implications for public health messaging regarding exercise timing and intensity to improve sleep health.

研究表明，睡前四小时内运动，特别是高强度运动，与入睡延迟、睡眠时间缩短、睡眠质量下降、静息心率升高和心率变异性降低有关。这些结果已针对年龄、性别和既往睡眠等因素进行了调整。高强度运动包括显著提高心率和呼吸的活动，如高强度间歇训练或长跑。

研究人员建议，旨在改善睡眠健康的人应在睡前至少四小时结束运动。如果在该时间范围内运动，他们建议进行低强度活动，如慢跑或游泳。该研究强调，傍晚运动，特别是高强度运动，会扰乱睡眠并损害身体的恢复过程。这些发现对于公共健康信息中关于运动时间和强度以改善睡眠健康的信息具有重要意义。

title: The VTech Socratic Method
summary:
This article details the author's exploration and modification of a VTech Socrates, a hybrid video game console/computer from 1988. The author acquired a dirty, damaged Socrates from eBay and began by cleaning and disassembling it. The internal components revealed a Z80 processor, Toshiba chips, and an integrated gate array, typical for a low-cost machine.

A key focus was the installation of an AV mod to improve the video output, building upon a simpler design by Johnny Blanchard. The author designed a custom PCB with a video amplifier and voltage regulator but encountered several design flaws and assembly challenges, including poor strain relief and difficult soldering.

The author then tested the system, finding the video acceptable but the audio excessively loud. The Socrates uses an infrared keyboard, powered by four AA batteries. The purpose of a switch inside the keyboard remained a mystery.

Finally, the author explored the "Around the World" cartridge, identifying a Toshiba 1Mbit mask ROM. A pinout of the cartridge edge connector was created, bearing similarities to the VTech Precomputer. The ROM for "Around the World" was located within the MAME software list, and the author intends to use the knowledge gained to run custom code on the system.

title: What If We Could Rebuild Kafka from Scratch?
summary:
Gunnar Morling's blog post explores the idea of rebuilding Kafka from scratch, envisioning a "Kafka.next" optimized for cloud environments. Inspired by projects like Diskless Kafka and AutoMQ, which aim to improve Kafka's elasticity and cost-effectiveness by leveraging object storage, Morling presents a wishlist of features for this hypothetical system.

Key features include:

*   **Eliminating Partitions:** Replace partition-based scaling with object storage, focusing instead on global or key-based ordering.
*   **Key-Centric Access:** Allow efficient access and replay of messages based on key, enabling millions of entity-level streams.
*   **Topic Hierarchies:** Implement structured topic identifiers for efficient subscription to subsets of streams.
*   **Concurrency Control:** Introduce optimistic locking for message keys to prevent conflicting writes.
*   **Broker-Side Schema Support:** Integrate schema management directly into Kafka for better user experience and interoperability with formats like Apache Iceberg.
*   **Extensibility and Pluggability:** Enable custom broker-side message filters, transformations, and storage formats through extensions.
*   **Synchronous Commit Callbacks:** Guarantee that downstream data views have been updated when a produce request is acknowledged.
*   **Snapshotting:** Support "logical compaction" by creating snapshots of entity states, allowing for removal of older delta events.
*   **Multi-tenancy:** Design the system with multi-tenancy in mind from the ground up.

Morling acknowledges that some of these features exist in other systems but highlights the potential of a unified open-source solution. He concludes by suggesting that an LSM tree-based architecture would be a likely choice for building such a system.

*   **主题层次结构：** 实施结构化的主题标识符，以便高效订阅流的子集。

*   **多租户：** 从一开始就以多租户为目标来设计系统。

Morling承认其中一些功能已存在于其他系统中，但他强调了统一开源解决方案的潜力。 他最后建议，基于LSM树的架构可能是构建此类系统的可行选择。

title: Scientists Develop Artificial Leaf, Uses Sunlight to Produce Valuable Chemicals
summary:
Scientists at Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory, in collaboration with the Liquid Sunlight Alliance (LiSA), have developed an "artificial leaf" that uses sunlight to convert carbon dioxide into valuable C2 chemicals, precursors to products like plastics and jet fuel. This device mimics photosynthesis, combining perovskite (a solar panel material) with a copper-based electrocatalyst.

The device consists of a photoanode and photocathode.  Lead halide perovskite photoabsorbers absorb light like chlorophyll in a real leaf, while copper electrocatalysts, inspired by natural enzymes, facilitate the conversion of CO2. Unlike previous attempts using biological materials, this system utilizes inorganic copper, making it more durable and stable.

A solar simulator was used to test the device, demonstrating successful CO2 conversion into C2 molecules using only sunlight. This breakthrough represents a significant step toward sustainable production of valuable chemicals and liquid fuels, offering a potential pathway for reducing reliance on fossil fuels and mitigating carbon emissions. Researchers are now focused on increasing the system's efficiency and scalability. The research contributes to LiSA's overall goal of developing liquid fuels from sunlight, carbon dioxide, and water.

title: Show HN: BugStalker - a modern Rust debugger
summary:
BugStalker is a modern Rust debugger designed for Linux x86-64 architectures, built specifically for debugging Rust programs. Key features include core debugging functionalities like breakpoints, stepping, and signal/watchpoint handling. It offers advanced runtime inspection with full multithreading support, data query expressions, and deep Rust type system integration (including support for collections, smart pointers, and thread locals). It leverages the `core::fmt::Debug` trait for variable rendering.

BugStalker provides flexible interfaces, allowing users to switch between console and TUI modes, and supports asynchronous Rust debugging, including Tokio runtime inspection. The debugger features an extensible architecture with an Oracle extension mechanism, including a built-in Tokio oracle (similar to tokio_console but requiring no code modification).

The project encourages contributions, welcomes suggestions, and provides guidelines for contributing. BugStalker is distributed under the MIT License. Installation instructions are available on the project's website.

After receiving a round "African Daisy global forever vert pair" stamp, the author prepared the request, addressed it to the FSF, and mailed it from the UK.

The printed text was on US letter-sized paper, further highlighting the geographical context of the FSF. While the author didn't explicitly specify GPLv2 in the request, they wondered if the license notice's address should have been a clue. Ultimately, the author decided not to pursue a correction and was satisfied with receiving any version of the license, needing rest after the postal endeavor.

title: A $20k American-made electric pickup with no paint, no stereo, no screen
summary:
The Slate Truck, an American-made electric pickup aiming for a sub-$20,000 price point (after incentives), is set to disrupt the EV market with its minimalist approach. Produced by Michigan-based Slate Auto, this two-seater EV boasts a 150-mile range and a utilitarian design. Key features include a lack of paint (using injection-molded polypropylene composite material), no stereo, and no touchscreen, emphasizing durability, customization, and affordability.

Slate's design philosophy centers around embracing imperfections and offering extensive personalization options, including DIY vinyl wrap kits and an optional SUV upgrade kit with rear seating. Manufacturing is radically simplified by eliminating the paint shop and using plastic body panels, allowing for lower production costs and a smaller factory footprint in Indiana.

The company is adopting a direct sales model similar to Tesla, bypassing traditional dealerships. Maintenance is also encouraged to be DIY with support from "Slate University," although partnerships with established service centers will exist for those who prefer professional assistance. 

The absence of infotainment systems aims to boost reliability and reduce warranty claims. While the basic model lacks entertainment features, the interior is designed for easy upgrades. Slate is targeting high safety ratings. Deliveries are planned for late 2026. The company has attracted significant investment, reportedly including Jeff Bezos. The success of Slate Truck hinges on consumer willingness to embrace a stripped-down, highly customizable electric vehicle.

title: A Visual Journey Through Async Rust
summary:
This article provides a visual exploration of async Rust's concurrency and parallelism, emphasizing the importance of understanding how CPU-intensive code impacts async execution. Using visualizations of sine wave calculations, the author demonstrates that Tokio futures execute concurrently, not in parallel, unless explicitly managed.

The core takeaway is that CPU-intensive operations in a single Tokio task can block the async executor, negatively affecting other concurrent tasks.  Even seemingly short CPU-bound tasks can cause significant delays.  The author then explores using `tokio::spawn` to create new tasks, allowing futures to run in parallel on different threads, thus leveraging multiple CPU cores and isolating CPU-intensive operations.  The visualizations clearly show how spawning tasks improves overall performance by preventing one long-running operation from blocking others.

However, the article cautions that spawning too many tasks can lead to contention and diminish performance gains, as Tokio juggles tasks between available threads.  Finally, `tokio::task::spawn_blocking` is introduced as a method to offload blocking (non-async) code to a dedicated thread pool, achieving potentially maximum CPU utilization. While satisfying to visualize, the author correctly points out that context switching between these many threads can still impact performance and suggests exploring other options for CPU heavy tasks. The author concludes that visualising async tasks helps grasp nuances of async Rust, particularly multicore utilization and the concurrency/parallelism trade-offs.
chinese_title: 异步Rust的视觉之旅

异步Rust的并发与并行：可视化探索

本文通过可视化方式探索了异步Rust的并发与并行，强调理解CPU密集型代码如何影响异步执行的重要性。作者通过正弦波计算的可视化演示，表明Tokio futures 以并发方式执行，而非并行方式，除非进行显式管理。

核心要点是，单个Tokio任务中的CPU密集型操作可能会阻塞异步执行器，从而对其他并发任务产生负面影响。即使看似很短的CPU密集型任务也可能导致显著的延迟。然后，作者探讨了使用 `tokio::spawn` 创建新任务，允许 futures 在不同的线程上并行运行，从而利用多个CPU内核并隔离CPU密集型操作。可视化清晰地展示了生成任务如何通过防止一个长时间运行的操作阻塞其他操作来提高整体性能。

然而，本文警告说，生成过多的任务可能会导致竞争并降低性能增益，因为Tokio会在可用线程之间调度任务。最后，介绍了 `tokio::task::spawn_blocking`，作为一种将阻塞（非异步）代码卸载到专用线程池的方法，从而可能实现最大的CPU利用率。 虽然可视化效果令人满意，但作者正确地指出，这些线程之间的上下文切换仍然会影响性能，并建议探索其他处理CPU密集型任务的方案。作者总结说，可视化异步任务有助于掌握异步Rust的细微差别，特别是多核利用率以及并发/并行的权衡。

The original researchers stand by their findings, arguing their atmospheric model is more realistic. However, Taylor maintains his analysis is a valid and commonly used method.

The debate highlights the challenges in interpreting complex astronomical data and the importance of rigorous analysis. Kevin Stevenson from Johns Hopkins University emphasizes the exoplanet community's frustration with the over-enthusiastic initial announcement. He warns against making premature claims that could erode public trust in scientists. title: One quantum transition makes light at 21 cm
summary:
This article explains the significance of the 21-centimeter wavelength light emitted by neutral hydrogen atoms as a tool for studying the universe, particularly its earliest stages. This emission arises from a quantum transition known as the spin-flip transition, where the electron in a hydrogen atom changes from an aligned to an anti-aligned spin state relative to the proton. This transition is unique because it is highly precise, producing light with a very narrow and well-defined wavelength.

The author explains how atoms can exist only in specific energy configurations, leading to the absorption and emission of light at discrete wavelengths. While "coarse structure" transitions are common, "fine" and "hyperfine" structures, like the spin-flip transition, offer more detailed insights. Quantum tunneling allows this "forbidden" transition, though it takes an average of 10 million years per atom.

The abundance of hydrogen (92% of the atoms in the early Universe) makes this 21 cm emission a powerful tool for mapping the distribution of neutral hydrogen gas, even in regions where no stars have formed. By observing the redshifted 21 cm signal from distant gas clouds, astronomers hope to probe the early Universe and gain a better understanding of its evolution, including the formation of the first stars and galaxies. The article concludes by emphasizing the potential of 21 cm astronomy to unlock secrets hidden deep in the cosmic past.

title: PyGraph: Robust Compiler Support for CUDA Graphs in PyTorch
summary:
This arXiv article, "PyGraph: Robust Compiler Support for CUDA Graphs in PyTorch," introduces PyGraph, a novel approach to automatically leverage CUDA Graphs within the PyTorch 2 framework. CUDA Graphs, a recent NVIDIA GPU hardware feature, aim to reduce CPU launch overhead by capturing and launching GPU tasks as a DAG. However, their static structure and data copy overheads often lead to performance degradation in practice.

The authors address these challenges by presenting three key optimizations embodied in PyGraph. First, PyGraph enables wider deployment of CUDA Graphs. Second, it reduces GPU kernel parameter copy overheads. Third, it selectively deploys CUDA Graphs based on a cost-benefit analysis. This selective deployment acknowledges that CUDA Graphs aren't always beneficial and uses performance modeling to determine when they will provide a net gain.

PyGraph seamlessly integrates with PyTorch 2's compilation toolchain, allowing developers to benefit from CUDA Graphs without manual code modifications. The authors evaluate PyGraph across various machine learning benchmarks, demonstrating substantial performance improvements compared to PyTorch 2 alone. The research highlights the importance of intelligent compiler support for hardware features like CUDA Graphs to fully unlock their potential in deep learning frameworks.

这篇arXiv文章“PyGraph：PyTorch中CUDA图的稳健编译器支持”介绍了PyGraph，一种在PyTorch 2框架内自动利用CUDA图的新方法。CUDA图是NVIDIA GPU最近的一项硬件特性，旨在通过将GPU任务捕获并作为DAG启动来减少CPU启动开销。然而，它们的静态结构和数据复制开销通常会导致实际性能下降。

作者通过PyGraph中体现的三个关键优化来应对这些挑战。首先，PyGraph使CUDA图能够更广泛地部署。其次，它减少了GPU内核参数复制开销。第三，它基于成本效益分析选择性地部署CUDA图。这种选择性部署承认CUDA图并非总是受益，并使用性能建模来确定它们何时会提供净收益。

PyGraph与PyTorch 2的编译工具链无缝集成，使开发人员无需手动修改代码即可受益于CUDA图。作者在各种机器学习基准测试中评估了PyGraph，与仅使用PyTorch 2 相比，展示了显著的性能提升。该研究强调了智能编译器支持对于像CUDA图这样的硬件特性至关重要，以充分释放它们在深度学习框架中的潜力。

title: Century-old genetics mystery of Mendel's peas solved
summary:
A century-old genetics mystery surrounding Gregor Mendel's pea plant experiments has been solved. Researchers have identified the genes responsible for three of the seven traits Mendel studied in pea plants, specifically pod color, pod shape, and flower arrangement (fasciation).

Mendel, a pioneer in genetics, meticulously cross-bred approximately 28,000 pea plants in the mid-19th century to understand how traits were inherited. While a reference genome for the pea plant (Pisum sativum) was published in 2019, the genetic basis for these three traits remained elusive.

Now, using advanced sequencing and computational tools, researchers analyzed nearly 700 pea genomes containing 155 million single-nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs). Through selective breeding and genome-wide association studies, they pinpointed the genes responsible. The team discovered that pod color is controlled by a gene affecting chlorophyll biosynthesis, leading to green or yellow pods. Pod shape is likely controlled by two genes impacting cell-wall thickening. Finally, flower arrangement is influenced by a deletion in a gene that causes branching or clustering.

This breakthrough, six years in the making, underscores the power of interdisciplinary collaboration and provides a deeper understanding of Mendel's original observations. It also marks a new phase in the genomic study of peas, a crucial source of plant-based protein.

title: Fundamental flaws of SIMD ISAs (2021)
summary:
This article critiques packed SIMD ISAs, commonly found in consumer CPUs, highlighting three fundamental flaws: fixed register width, pipelining issues, and cumbersome tail handling.

The fixed register width necessitates new instructions and registers for increased parallelism, complicating ABI updates, OS kernel modifications, compiler support, and debugger adaptation. This also leads to instruction set bloat as older SIMD generations become redundant, forcing developers to target multiple SIMD versions for optimal performance across different CPUs.

Pipelining SIMD operations, requiring multiple clock cycles, necessitates loop unrolling to avoid stalls and keep the pipeline busy. This, however, increases code size, negatively impacting instruction cache performance and increasing register pressure, requiring more SIMD registers to avoid spilling.

Finally, tail handling, where the number of array elements isn't a multiple of the SIMD register size, adds extra code and control logic before and after the main loop, further increasing code size and complexity.

The article proposes alternatives like Vector Processors (e.g., Cray-1, RISC-V RVV, ARM SVE) which handle unrolling and tailing in hardware, resulting in more compact and efficient code. It also mentions the Virtual Vector Method (VVM) employed by My 66000, enabling vectorization without vector registers. Code examples demonstrate the relative complexity and verbosity of a packed SIMD implementation versus vector and predicated SIMD implementations.

title: A Principled Approach to Querying Data – A Type-Safe Search DSL
summary:
This article presents a type-safe search system built using a Domain-Specific Language (DSL) tailored for querying "issues," a concept common in project management. The core idea is to leverage a DSL for expressive and maintainable search, benefiting from controlled complexity, domain alignment, enhanced usability, and a formal grammar that simplifies maintainability and extensibility.

The system defines an `Issue` interface representing the data structure and utilizes the `Either` type for robust error handling during parsing. Parser combinators, a functional programming technique, are employed to build parsers modularly. These combinators, such as `lit`, `word`, `alt`, `seq`, `many`, and `map`, break down the parsing process into smaller, composable units.

The article emphasizes the creation of an Abstract Syntax Tree (AST) to represent the query's structure, separating syntax from semantics for optimization and flexibility. The AST is then transformed into an `IssuePredicate` function for filtering. The `executeQuery` function orchestrates the entire process, handling parsing errors and applying the predicate to the data.

While suitable for moderate datasets, the article acknowledges performance limitations with large datasets due to its linear scan approach. It suggests indexing, query optimization, query planning, and caching strategies to improve performance, potentially utilizing database solutions like IndexedDB or SQLite for storage. The conclusion highlights the benefits of a principled approach, emphasizing type safety, functional programming, and separation of concerns for building robust and user-friendly search experiences.

title: Careless People
summary:
This article reviews Sarah Wynn-Williams's memoir, "Careless People," which details her experiences working in global policy at Facebook. The review highlights Wynn-Williams's journey from a minor functionary in the New Zealand diplomatic corps, driven by a passion for Facebook's potential, to a key player in the company's global expansion.

The book exposes the dysfunctional and often unethical behavior of Facebook's top executives, including Mark Zuckerberg, Sheryl Sandberg, and Joel Kaplan. Zuckerberg is portrayed as immature and unwilling to be briefed, Sandberg as self-promoting and playing petty games, and Kaplan as insensitive and oafish. The review emphasizes Facebook's initial disinterest in countries outside the US, driven by the US market's profitability due to its large population and lack of privacy protections.

As Facebook saturated the US market, it turned its attention to global expansion, making Wynn-Williams's work crucial. However, the company's leaders often squandered opportunities due to carelessness and arrogance. The review also highlights Kaplan's sexual harassment of Wynn-Williams, which went unaddressed by those in power.

The review discusses Facebook's relentless pursuit of the Chinese market, including Zuckerberg's unsuccessful attempts to court Xi Jinping and the company's willingness to provide surveillance and censorship to appease the Chinese government. Ultimately, Wynn-Williams becomes disillusioned with Facebook's behavior and leaves the company, having witnessed its careless and cruel actions firsthand. The author ties this behavior to the pressures of maintaining high growth to sustain its stock price and competitive advantage.

title: Assignment 5: Cars and Key Fobs (2021)

title: Launch HN: Cua (YC X25) – Open-Source Docker Container for Computer-Use Agents

Key benefits include enhanced security and isolation by running agents in virtual environments, near-native performance, flexibility to run macOS or Linux, reproducible environments, and built-in LLM integration.

title: Show HN: Colanode, open-source and local-first Slack and Notion alternative
summary:
Colanode is presented as an open-source, local-first alternative to tools like Slack and Notion, emphasizing data privacy and control through self-hosting. It's an all-in-one workspace offering real-time chat, rich text pages (similar to Notion), customizable databases (tables, kanban, calendar), and file management. Colanode is designed for both individuals and teams and features a desktop app that connects to self-hosted servers, or for ease of testing, free beta cloud servers provided by the project.

The core innovation is its local-first workflow, where all changes are saved locally using SQLite and then synced to the server, allowing offline work and immediate data access. Concurrent editing is supported via Conflict-free Replicated Data Types (CRDTs) powered by Yjs, ensuring graceful merging of simultaneous edits.

To get started, users download the desktop app and connect to either the Colanode Cloud (EU or US) beta servers or self-host using Docker. Self-hosting requires Postgres with the pgvector extension, Redis (or Valkey), and S3-compatible storage. The Colanode server API is provided as a Docker image, and environment variables are detailed in the docker-compose file. Colanode is licensed under Apache 2.0.

title: Microsoft subtracts C/C++ extension from VS Code forks
summary:
Microsoft has stopped its C/C++ extension for Visual Studio Code from working with derivative products like VS Codium and Cursor, sparking outrage from developers. The extension, which provides crucial C/C++ language support features, stopped functioning in these forks after the release of v1.24.5 on April 3, 2025.  Microsoft's licensing terms have long forbidden using its extensions outside its products, but this is the first time it's been enforced for the C/C++ extension through an environment check in the binaries.

Cursor, an AI code assistant built on VS Code, had been masking its network requests to the Microsoft Visual Studio Marketplace to circumvent these restrictions. However, they are now planning to transition to open-source alternatives for these extensions.

VS Codium users are also seeking open-source solutions. One developer has even filed a complaint with the US Federal Trade Commission, accusing Microsoft of anti-competitive practices by blocking rivals like Cursor to lock users into its AI ecosystem, particularly in light of Microsoft's competing AI agent, Agent Mode in Copilot. Microsoft has not yet commented on the matter.

title: Show HN: Infat – Declaritive application assocation manager for macOS
summary:

It allows you to easily set the default applications for opening specific file types (like `.txt`, `.md`, or `.pdf`) and URL schemes (like `mailto:` or `web`) without navigating through system preferences.

Key features include:

*   **Listing associations:** See which apps are registered for a given file extension or URL scheme.
*   **Setting default apps:** Define the default application for specific file types and URL schemes.
*   **TOML configuration:** Define all associations in a TOML configuration file for easy version control and sharing.
*   **Scriptability:**  It is designed to be used in scripts and automation pipelines.
*   **macOS-native:** Utilizes native macOS frameworks for robust integration.

Infat can be installed via Homebrew or built from source using Swift. The tool is configured via the command line or through a TOML configuration file, enabling a simple and repeatable way to manage application associations. It's open-source (MIT license) and aims to give power users and administrators more control over application handling.

title: The Gruen Transfer is consuming the internet
summary:
Sebastian David Lees' blog post discusses the "Gruen Transfer," a phenomenon where a deliberately confusing layout disorients consumers and leads them to impulse purchases or straying from their original intentions. Originally observed in physical stores, the Gruen Transfer is now prevalent online.

The author argues that platforms like Facebook, designed to simplify updates, have become confusing labyrinths dominated by ads, memes, and influencer marketing, diverting users from their intended purpose (connecting with friends). This disorientation isn't limited to social media; many websites are structured to encourage impulsive actions and "rabbit hole" explorations, like falling into Wikipedia tangents.

The article highlights the Gruen Transfer's connection to UX dark patterns, particularly in difficult processes like deleting social media accounts, altering insurance policies, or canceling subscriptions. These processes are intentionally convoluted to discourage users from achieving their goals.

Lees questions the long-term consequences of this increasing complexity and suggests it may reach a point of diminishing returns, creating excessive friction. He applauds the EU's legislation mandating equal ease for subscribing and canceling services, measuring complexity as a key factor. He concludes with a desire to see similar principles applied to physical retail environments.
chinese_title: 格林效应席卷互联网。
chinese_summary:

作者认为，像Facebook这样的平台，原本旨在简化更新，现在却变成了由广告、表情包和网红营销主导的令人困惑的迷宫，转移了用户与朋友联系的初衷。这种迷失方向不仅限于社交媒体；许多网站的结构都旨在鼓励冲动行为和“兔子洞”探索，比如陷入维基百科的旁枝末节。

这篇文章强调了格鲁恩转换与用户体验暗黑模式的联系，尤其是在删除社交媒体账户、更改保险政策或取消订阅等困难流程中。这些流程是有意设计的繁琐复杂，以阻止用户实现其目标。

李斯质疑这种日益增长的复杂性的长期后果，并认为它可能达到收益递减的临界点，造成过多的摩擦。他赞扬了欧盟立法，该立法规定订阅和取消服务必须同样容易，并将复杂性作为关键衡量标准。他最后表示，希望看到类似的原则应用于实体零售环境。

title: Mark Zuckerberg says social media is over
summary:
This article analyzes the FTC's antitrust case against Meta (Facebook), arguing that the commission's definition of the social media industry is outdated and doesn't reflect the current digital landscape. The FTC claims Meta illegally maintained a monopoly in "personal social networking services" by acquiring Instagram and WhatsApp, stifling innovation and reducing consumer choice.

However, the article highlights that social media has evolved from interpersonal communication to a broader platform for consuming various content, making it difficult to define a specific market dominated by Meta. Meta argues that the company's platforms are now part of a crowded marketplace with competitors like TikTok and YouTube, all offering similar content formats.

The article notes that proving consumer harm is challenging because Meta's platforms are free. It also questions whether an independent WhatsApp would have necessarily been more innovative than the version owned by Meta.

One key revelation from Zuckerberg's testimony was a 2018 memo where he suggested spinning off Instagram to avoid potential antitrust regulations.

The article concludes by suggesting the FTC might be focusing on an outdated problem, as the digital landscape is rapidly changing with the rise of TikTok, generative AI, and new social networks. The article also mentions the recent fines levied against Apple and Meta by the EU for anti-competitive practices.
chinese_title: 马克·扎克伯格称社交媒体已结束。

然而，本文强调，社交媒体已经从人际交流演变为消费各种内容的更广泛平台，使得界定一个由Meta主导的特定市场变得困难。Meta辩称，该公司的平台现在是拥挤的市场的一部分，与TikTok和YouTube等竞争对手一同提供类似的内容形式。

title: Mistaking Mary Magdalene
summary:
This article explores the complex and often misrepresented figure of Mary Magdalene, delving into the historical and religious controversies surrounding her identity. It begins by referencing an icon of Mary of Egypt, a former prostitute, and how her image has become conflated with Mary Magdalene's over time.

The author examines the New Testament's limited and sometimes contradictory accounts of Magdalene, contrasting them with other texts like the Gospel of Philip, which portrays her as a close companion and manifestation of divine wisdom. The article highlights how Pope Gregory the Great wrongly identified Mary Magdalene as a repentant prostitute, leading to centuries of mischaracterization and the marginalization of women within the Church.

The author investigates the story of Mary of Egypt, emphasizing her transformation and spiritual journey through desire and repentance, contrasting it with common perceptions of Mary Magdalene. The article further explores how artistic representations of Magdalene, particularly during the Renaissance, contributed to the portrayal of her as a penitent sinner, often depicted in a state of undress.

Finally, the author discusses the Gospel of Mary, excluded from the canon, and its portrayal of Magdalene as a spiritual teacher who transmits Jesus's secret teachings. The article concludes by emphasizing the importance of engaging with Mary Magdalene's story with an open mind, embracing the myth and poetry surrounding her to uncover a more nuanced and empowering understanding of this pivotal figure in Christianity. The essence of Magdalene lies not in dogmatic truth, but in a "slantwise truth" accessible through divine imagination.
chinese_title: 误认抹大拉的玛丽亚

作者考察了《新约》中对抹大拉的马利亚的有限且有时矛盾的描述，并将其与《腓力福音》等其他文本进行对比，后者将她描绘成一位亲密的同伴和神圣智慧的体现。文章强调了教皇格列高利一世错误地将抹大拉的马利亚认定为一位忏悔的妓女，导致了几个世纪的错误描述以及教会内部女性的边缘化。

作者调查了埃及的马利亚的故事，强调了她通过欲望和忏悔实现的转变和精神之旅，并将其与对抹大拉的马利亚的常见看法进行对比。文章进一步探讨了抹大拉的马利亚的艺术表现形式，尤其是在文艺复兴时期，如何促成了将她描绘成一位忏悔的罪人，经常以衣衫不整的状态出现。

最后，作者讨论了被排除在正典之外的《马利亚福音》，以及它将抹大拉的马利亚描绘成一位传递耶稣秘密教义的精神导师。文章最后强调了以开放的心态参与抹大拉的马利亚的故事的重要性，拥抱围绕她的神话和诗歌，以揭示对基督教中这个关键人物更细致和更具力量的理解。抹大拉的马利亚的本质不在于教条式的真理，而在于通过神圣想象力才能获得的“斜向真理”。

title: Show HN: Zev – Remember (or discover) terminal commands
summary:
Zev is a command-line tool that helps users remember or discover terminal commands using natural language queries. It leverages the OpenAI API to translate natural language descriptions into executable commands. Users can install Zev via `pip install zev` and then run it in interactive mode (`zev`) or directly with a query (`zev '<what you want to do>'`). Alternatively, Zev can be configured to run locally using Ollama, allowing you to run commands without relying on the OpenAI API. This requires installing and running Ollama with a suitable model, then configuring Zev to point to the Ollama API endpoint (e.g., `http://localhost:11434/v1`) via `zev --setup`.

The project encourages contributions and is licensed under the MIT License.

title: In the age of AI, we must protect human creativity as a natural resource
summary:
In the face of rapidly advancing AI, human creativity is at risk of being devalued and homogenized, argues Benj Edwards in this Ars Technica article. AI models, trained by scraping vast amounts of online content, threaten to flood the digital landscape with synthetic media, potentially drowning out original human expression and depleting the creative ecosystem.

Edwards contends that human creativity is a finite resource, dependent on lived experiences and cognitive diversity. The current AI industry approach treats it as an inexhaustible commodity, mirroring early industrialists' exploitation of natural resources. This poses several threats, including digital pollution from AI-generated spam, infrastructure strain from aggressive AI crawlers, and the potential for "model collapse," where AI models trained on their own outputs degrade collective knowledge.

The article explores the ethical and legal dimensions of AI training, contrasting Adobe's licensing model with OpenAI's "fair use" argument. It highlights the tension between artists concerned about losing livelihoods and AI developers seeking to leverage existing works. Copyright is presented as a form of resource management crucial for the replenishment of the public domain.

Edwards proposes several solutions for protecting human creativity, including opt-in AI training legislation, royalty systems, "creative reserves" inspired by Japan's "Living National Treasures," and an "AI commons" where publicly scraped AI models are collectively owned. Technical defenses against AI crawlers are also discussed.

Ultimately, the author emphasizes the importance of investing in people, arguing that organizations that cultivate unique human perspectives and integrate them with thoughtful AI augmentation will outperform those that solely rely on AI automation. Human insight and connection remain invaluable in a world increasingly saturated with AI-generated content.

title: Asymmetric Content Moderation in Search Markets: The Case of Adult Websites
summary:
This article, "Asymmetric Content Moderation in Search Markets: The Case of Adult Websites," investigates the competitive consequences of content moderation by dominant online platforms, specifically focusing on the adult content industry. The study analyzes the impact of a policy change by the largest adult content platform that removed all non-verified content, resulting in an 80% reduction of its video library.

Using a difference-in-differences approach and analyzing daily website traffic data, the authors found that the policy led to a significant 41% drop in traffic to the platform within one month, indicating strong user preference for the removed content. Crucially, much of this displaced traffic shifted to competitor platforms, including both mainstream and less regulated "fringe" websites. Fringe sites saw a substantial 55% increase in visits over six months, significantly exceeding the 10% growth of mainstream rivals.

The research highlights the crucial role of search engines in this reallocation, as fringe platforms experienced a surge in traffic from search referrals and aggregators as users sought alternative content sources. Furthermore, the study reveals intensified competition in search, with the leading platform becoming more aggressive in using DMCA filings to remove competing content from search results.

The findings underscore how uneven content moderation can reshape market competition, drive users towards less regulated platforms, and alter user substitution patterns across different online services.

title: Three things everyone should know about Vision Transformers
summary:
This paper, "Three things everyone should know about Vision Transformers," by Touvron et al., explores improvements and efficiencies in Vision Transformer (ViT) architectures, which have become prominent in computer vision tasks. The authors present three key insights:

1.  **Parallel Processing of Residual Layers:** The sequential processing of residual layers, a common practice in ViTs, can be, to a certain extent, processed in parallel without significantly impacting accuracy. This offers potential speed improvements.

2.  **Efficient Fine-Tuning:** Fine-tuning only the attention layers' weights is sufficient for adapting ViTs to higher resolutions or new classification tasks. This approach significantly reduces computational cost and memory consumption during fine-tuning, while also allowing for greater weight sharing across different tasks.

3.  **Improved Self-Supervised Training:** Adding MLP-based patch pre-processing layers enhances the effectiveness of Bert-like self-supervised training based on masking patches.

The authors validate these findings using the ImageNet-1k dataset and confirm their robustness on the ImageNet-v2 test set. Transfer performance is also evaluated across six smaller datasets. The research contributes valuable insights into optimizing ViT architectures, leading to more efficient training, fine-tuning, and improved performance.

作者使用 ImageNet-1k 数据集验证了这些发现，并在 ImageNet-v2 测试集上证实了它们的稳健性。还在六个较小的数据集上评估了迁移性能。该研究为优化 ViT 架构提供了宝贵的见解，从而实现更高效的训练、微调和改进的性能。

title: Mary MacLane, the Wild Woman from Butte
summary:
Hunter Dukes' article explores the life and sensation caused by Mary MacLane, a young woman from Butte, Montana, who published her scandalous journal, *The Story of Mary MacLane*, in 1902 at the age of 19. The article highlights MacLane's frank and unconventional writing, which explored her inner life, bisexuality, and dissatisfaction with societal norms.

MacLane's writing style was conversational, self-celebratory, and autofictional, defying the conventions of the time. She declared herself a genius and expressed her desires openly, including romantic interests in both men (Napoleon, the Devil) and women (her teacher, Fannie Corbin).

The book became an instant sensation, selling nearly 100,000 copies in the first month. Critics were divided, but MacLane gained a following and sparked a cultural phenomenon, with "Mary MacLane societies" forming across the country. She was compared to Marie Bashkirtseff and was known as "The Butte Bashkirtseff."

The article also details the aftermath of MacLane's success, including bizarre events and spoofs of her work. MacLane travelled east, engaging with figures like Harriet Monroe and Zona Gale, presenting conflicting accounts of her desires and self-perception. The article suggests that MacLane was consciously constructing a persona, acknowledging that she never fully revealed her "real self" and was "playing a deep game."
chinese_title: 玛丽·麦克莱恩，来自比尤特的狂野女人
chinese_summary:
Hunter Dukes的文章探讨了玛丽·麦克莱恩的生活和引起的轰动。玛丽·麦克莱恩是蒙大拿州比尤特的一位年轻女子，1902年年仅19岁时出版了她那本引人争议的日记《玛丽·麦克莱恩的故事》。这篇文章着重介绍了麦克莱恩坦率和非传统的写作风格，这种风格探索了她的内心世界、双性恋以及对社会规范的不满。

麦克莱恩的写作风格是对话式的、自我赞扬的和自传式虚构的，这挑战了当时的传统。她宣称自己是天才，并公开表达了自己的欲望，包括对男性（拿破仑、魔鬼）和女性（她的老师范妮·科宾）的浪漫兴趣。

这本书立刻引起轰动，第一个月就卖出了近10万册。评论界褒贬不一，但麦克莱恩获得了一批追随者，并引发了一种文化现象，全国各地都成立了“玛丽·麦克莱恩协会”。她被比作玛丽·巴什基尔采娃，并被称为“比尤特的巴什基尔采娃”。

这篇文章还详细介绍了麦克莱恩成功后的情况，包括一些怪诞事件和对其作品的恶搞。麦克莱恩向东旅行，与哈丽雅特·门罗和佐娜·盖尔等人物交往，呈现出对其欲望和自我认知的矛盾描述。这篇文章表明，麦克莱恩有意识地塑造了一个人物形象，承认她从未完全展现她的“真实自我”，而是在“玩一场深刻的游戏”。

title: On loyalty to your employer (2018)
summary:
Stevie Buckley's 2018 article, "On Loyalty to Your Employer," contrasts the tech industry's short tenures with his father's 30 years at one company, questioning the concept of employer loyalty. As a recruiter, Buckley admits to promoting companies, yet establishes a baseline of criteria for vetting employers: reasonable salaries, good treatment of employees (verified through Glassdoor and social media), financial security (especially crucial for startups), and openness to new ideas.

Buckley cautions against blindly embracing company culture, reminding readers that employment is a transaction. While a good work environment is positive, employees should not delude themselves into thinking their employer is family or friend. He emphasizes the importance of prioritizing family, mental well-being, and personal values over appeasing an employer, and warns against the "hustle" mentality.

The article advocates for mutual respect: hard work in exchange for fair compensation, employee well-being support, and investment in growth. Ultimately, Buckley underscores the importance of balancing work with life, echoing his father's sentiment that time spent with loved ones is more valuable than excessive dedication to work.
chinese_title: 对雇主的忠诚 (2018)
chinese_summary:
史蒂夫·巴克利2018年的文章《关于对雇主的忠诚》将科技行业的短工期与他父亲在一家公司工作30年形成对比，质疑了雇主忠诚的概念。作为一名招聘人员，巴克利承认自己会宣传公司，但同时也确立了一套筛选雇主的基准：合理的薪资、善待员工（通过 Glassdoor 和社交媒体验证）、财务安全（对初创公司尤其重要）以及对新想法的开放性。

巴克利告诫不要盲目拥抱公司文化，提醒读者雇佣关系是一种交易。虽然良好的工作环境是积极的，但员工不应自欺欺人地认为雇主是家人或朋友。他强调了优先考虑家庭、精神健康和个人价值观的重要性，而不是为了迎合雇主，并警告人们不要陷入“奋斗”心态。

这篇文章提倡相互尊重：努力工作以换取公平的报酬，支持员工的福祉，并投资于成长。最终，巴克利强调了平衡工作与生活的重要性，呼应了他父亲的观点，即与亲人共度时光比过度投入工作更有价值。

title: Creating your own federated microblog
summary:
This article is a tutorial for building a simple, federated microblogging platform using Fedify, an ActivityPub server framework, along with Node.js, npm, Hono, and TypeScript. The tutorial aims at developers familiar with web application basics like HTML, HTTP, SQL, JSON, and JavaScript, but no prior knowledge of TypeScript, JSX, ActivityPub, or Fedify is required.

The microblog will feature a single user account, the ability for other Fediverse users to follow and unfollow, post creation, following other Fediverse accounts, and viewing a chronological feed. To simplify the tutorial, some features like profile customization, post editing/deletion, unfollowing, likes, comments, search, and security features are excluded.

The tutorial guides the reader through setting up the development environment (Node.js, Fedify CLI), initializing a Fedify project, and using Visual Studio Code for development. It includes a brief introduction to TypeScript and JSX.

The first step is to create an account creation page using JSX, utilizing a layout component and the Pico CSS framework for styling. The goal is to build a functional microblog that can interact with other ActivityPub services. The complete source code is available on GitHub, with commits segmented to match the tutorial's steps.

title: Agent Mesh for Enterprise Agents
summary:
This article introduces the concept of an "Agent Mesh" as a new networking paradigm to support the rise of agentic systems in enterprises. Agentic systems, characterized by dynamic and emergent behavior, require a networking infrastructure that goes beyond traditional deterministic workflows. The Agent Mesh addresses the security, observability, discovery, and governance challenges inherent in these systems.

The Agent Mesh operates through an agent gateway, a specialized data plane optimized for AI communication patterns, focusing on Agent-to-LLM, Agent-to-Tool (via Model Context Protocol - MCP), and Agent-to-Agent (A2A) interactions. Key properties include security by default (mTLS, OIDC), Layer 7 native support, fine-grained access control, end-to-end observability, runtime registration and discovery, resilience, and a modern declarative configuration model.

The article emphasizes securing Agent-to-LLM communication, integrating agents with enterprise tools using MCP, and enabling multi-agent workflows. It highlights the importance of agent identity, zero-trust architecture, and fine-grained authorization policies. The Agent Mesh facilitates the registration and discovery of agents and tools while preventing tool poisoning.

A major benefit is its support for agents across any cloud environment, avoiding vendor lock-in. The Agent Mesh is composable, providing unified access to models, tools, and agents, with consistent policy enforcement and semantic understanding embedded at every layer. Solo.io positions itself as ready to deliver this infrastructure.
chinese_title: 企业代理的代理网格
chinese_summary:
本文介绍了一种名为“Agent Mesh”（代理网格）的新型网络范式，旨在支持企业中智能代理系统的兴起。智能代理系统具有动态和涌现行为的特点，需要一种超越传统确定性工作流程的网络基础设施。Agent Mesh旨在解决这些系统中固有的安全性、可观察性、发现和治理挑战。

Agent Mesh通过代理网关运行，该网关是一种专门针对AI通信模式优化的数据平面，侧重于代理到LLM、代理到工具（通过模型上下文协议-MCP）以及代理到代理（A2A）的交互。其关键属性包括默认安全性（mTLS、OIDC）、原生Layer 7支持、细粒度访问控制、端到端可观察性、运行时注册和发现、弹性以及现代声明式配置模型。

本文强调了保护代理到LLM的通信、使用MCP将代理与企业工具集成以及启用多代理工作流程。它强调了代理身份、零信任架构和细粒度授权策略的重要性。Agent Mesh有助于代理和工具的注册和发现，同时防止工具中毒。

一个主要优势是它支持跨任何云环境的代理，避免供应商锁定。Agent Mesh具有可组合性，提供对模型、工具和代理的统一访问，并在每一层嵌入一致的策略执行和语义理解。Solo.io 定位为已准备好交付这种基础设施。

title: PgDog is a transaction pooler logical replication manager can shard PostgreSQL
summary:
PgDog is a fast and secure, Rust-based transaction pooler and logical replication manager designed for sharding PostgreSQL databases. It can handle numerous databases and connections, offering features like load balancing, health checks, transaction pooling, and sharding capabilities. PgDog distributes transactions across replicas and primaries, routing queries based on strategies like round robin or query inspection. It supports automatic failover by monitoring host health and rerouting queries when needed.

PgDog efficiently manages a large number of clients with connection pooling, allowing them to share a limited number of PostgreSQL connections. Sharding capabilities enable automatic query routing to the appropriate shards based on sharding keys, supporting cross-shard queries. Furthermore, it offers a CSV parser for automated splitting of COPY commands across shards, as well as logical replication for background data distribution.

The system is highly configurable, allowing runtime adjustments. PgDog can be deployed via Kubernetes using a Helm chart or with Docker Compose. Monitoring is facilitated through both a PgBouncer-style admin database and an OpenMetrics endpoint, with Datadog configurations provided.

The project is under active development, welcoming early adopters. It is licensed under AGPL v3, which allows internal use and private modifications without requiring source code sharing.
chinese_title: PgDog 是一个事务池化逻辑复制管理器，可以对 PostgreSQL 进行分片。
chinese_summary:
PgDog：用于分片 PostgreSQL 数据库的快速安全、基于 Rust 的事务池化器和逻辑复制管理器。它可以处理大量数据库和连接，提供负载均衡、健康检查、事务池化和分片等功能。PgDog 将事务分发到副本和主节点，并根据轮询或查询检查等策略路由查询。它通过监控主机健康状况并在需要时重新路由查询来支持自动故障转移。

PgDog 通过连接池高效地管理大量客户端，允许它们共享有限数量的 PostgreSQL 连接。分片功能支持基于分片键自动将查询路由到适当的分片，并支持跨分片查询。此外，它还提供 CSV 解析器，用于自动跨分片拆分 COPY 命令，以及用于后台数据分发的逻辑复制。

该系统高度可配置，允许运行时调整。PgDog 可以通过 Helm chart 使用 Kubernetes 部署，也可以使用 Docker Compose 部署。通过 PgBouncer 风格的管理数据库和 OpenMetrics 端点来促进监控，并提供 Datadog 配置。

该项目正在积极开发中，欢迎早期采用者。它采用 AGPL v3 许可，允许内部使用和私下修改，而无需共享源代码。

title: Some __nonstring__ Turbulence
summary:
This LWN.net article discusses a recent kerfuffle in the Linux kernel development process surrounding the implementation of a new compiler warning in GCC 15, `-Wunterminated-string-initialization`. This warning flags potentially problematic C declarations where character arrays are initialized without a terminating NUL byte.

While intended to catch bugs, the warning generates false positives in the kernel code where char arrays are intentionally used as lookup tables rather than strings. A solution involved using the `__nonstring__` attribute to suppress the warning in these specific cases. Kees Cook has been working on integrating these fixes.

The trouble started when Linus Torvalds upgraded to Fedora 42, which included a pre-release version of GCC 15, just before releasing kernel version 6.15-rc3. The new compiler triggered the warnings, and Torvalds, without coordinating with Cook or checking the "-next" branch, quickly applied fixes directly to the mainline, breaking the build for older GCC versions.

After the release of 6.15-rc3, Torvalds reverted his changes and disabled the warning altogether, leading to a heated exchange with Cook, who felt his pre-prepared fixes were ignored. Torvalds defended his actions, citing the need to fix the broken build.

The article concludes by noting the resulting bad feelings and the need for better communication and coordination around compiler updates. It also mentions Torvalds' disagreement with the `__nonstring__` attribute's implementation, preferring a type-based annotation. The article highlights the challenges of incorporating new compiler features into a complex project like the Linux kernel and the importance of CI/testing.
chinese_title: 一些非字符串湍流
chinese_summary:
LWN.net文章讨论了Linux内核开发过程中最近发生的一场争论，起因是GCC 15中引入了一个新的编译器警告`-Wunterminated-string-initialization`。该警告会标记潜在问题的C声明，即字符数组初始化时缺少终止NUL字节。

虽然旨在发现错误，但该警告在内核代码中产生了误报，因为内核代码中有意将字符数组用作查找表而不是字符串。解决方案是使用`__nonstring__`属性来抑制这些特定情况下的警告。Kees Cook一直在努力整合这些修复。

麻烦始于Linus Torvalds在发布内核版本6.15-rc3之前，升级到了包含GCC 15预发布版本的Fedora 42。新编译器触发了警告，Torvalds在没有与Cook协调或检查"-next"分支的情况下，迅速将修复程序直接应用到主线，导致旧版本GCC的构建中断。

在发布6.15-rc3之后，Torvalds撤销了他的更改并完全禁用了该警告，这导致了他与Cook之间激烈的争论，Cook觉得他预先准备好的修复程序被忽略了。Torvalds为自己的行为辩护，理由是需要修复中断的构建。

文章最后指出，由此产生的负面情绪以及围绕编译器更新需要更好的沟通和协调。文章还提到Torvalds不同意`__nonstring__`属性的实现，更喜欢基于类型的注释。文章强调了将新编译器功能纳入像Linux内核这样复杂的项目中的挑战，以及CI/测试的重要性。

title: Apple and Meta fined millions for breaching EU law
summary:
Apple and Meta have been fined by EU antitrust regulators for breaching the Digital Markets Act (DMA), a landmark legislation aimed at curbing the power of Big Tech. Apple received a 500 million euro fine, while Meta was fined 200 million euros. The EU's action follows a year-long investigation into the companies' compliance with the DMA, which seeks to allow smaller rivals into markets dominated by the biggest companies.

The fines have sparked tensions, particularly with the United States, as the White House labeled them "economic extortion". However, the EU is standing firm in enforcing the DMA, encouraged by a U.S. court ruling against Google's dominance in online advertising technology.

Apple is accused of restricting app developers from directing users to cheaper deals outside the App Store and hindering users from sideloading apps. Meta's pay-or-consent model, offering ad-free service for a fee, was also deemed non-compliant. Both companies are challenging the EU decisions.

Despite the fines, some sources suggest they are relatively modest due to a focus on compliance, the short duration of the breaches, and a desire to avoid retaliation from the U.S. government. The companies have two months to comply with the EU's orders or face daily fines. The EU regulators did close an investigation into Apple's browser options on iPhones after Apple made changes that allowed users to switch to a rival browser or search engine more easily.

EU antitrust chief Teresa Ribera emphasized that all companies operating in the EU must follow its laws and respect European values. The EU is also urged to continue its investigations against Google and X.
chinese_title: 苹果和Meta因违反欧盟法律被处以数百万美元罚款
